name: Appalachia HIDTA
description: Federal High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area program that enhances and coordinates drug enforcement efforts of local, state and federal law enforcement agencies within designated areas. Pursues disruption and dismantlement of Drug Trafficking Organizations, particularly related to the specific drug threat of the Appalachian region. Provides training, deconfliction services, intelligence support, and investigative coordination.
source: Verified from official website and contact information
eligibility_requirements: Law enforcement agencies and officers working in designated HIDTA counties
populations_served: Law enforcement agencies, task forces, and communities in the Appalachian region
cost_information: Free services for law enforcement agencies
